content: Singaporean deanThis biography of a living person **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help by adding reliable sources. Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately** from the article and its talk page, especially if potentially libelous. *Find sources:* "Kuan Kim Seng" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(March 2015)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Kuan Kim Seng** is the first Bishop of the Horn of Africa in the [Province of Alexandria](/wiki/Episcopal/Anglican_Province_of_Alexandria), part of the worldwide [Anglican Communion](/wiki/Anglican_Communion), to which office he was consecrated on the creation of the Diocese in 2020. Before becoming the diocesan bishop, Kuan Kim Seng served as a commissary bishop the Horn of Africa, in what was the Diocese of Egypt with North Africa and the Horn of Africa. Bishop Kuan is Singaporean and served most of his career in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Previously he was one of two assistant bishops of the [Anglican Diocese of Singapore](/wiki/Anglican_Diocese_of_Singapore) in the [Church of the Province of Southeast Asia](/wiki/Church_of_the_Province_of_Southeast_Asia) and had served as [Dean of Singapore](/wiki/St_Andrew%27s_Cathedral,_Singapore). and as the vicar of the Chapel of the Resurrection in Singapore. ## Publications - *Our duty and our joy*, Armour Publishing Pte Ltd, 2007, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-9814222280 - Audio Sermons By Rt Revd Kuan Kim Seng, hosted by St Andrew's Cathedral This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Kuan Kim Seng
